<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 326, 294]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 300, 153, 314]]<|/det|>
Paper 1  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 905, 333]]<|/det|>
0606/12 October/November 2018 2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 339, 425, 355]]<|/det|>
Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 435, 375]]<|/det|>
Additional Materials: Electronic calculator  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 719, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 320, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 504, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 282, 516]]<|/det|>
Answer all the questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 828, 545]]<|/det|>
Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place in the case of angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 544, 593, 559]]<|/det|>
The use of an electronic calculator is expected, where appropriate.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 559, 603, 574]]<|/det|>
You are reminded of the need for clear presentation in your answers.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 584, 603, 599]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 599, 759, 614]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 614, 437, 629]]<|/det|>
The total number of marks for this paper is 80.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 73, 594, 91]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 165, 559, 183]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 196, 232, 214]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 226, 371, 245]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(a x^{2} + b x + c = 0,\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 243, 583, 279]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}.\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 301, 222, 319]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[252, 322, 745, 361]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n},\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 368, 490, 408]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 470, 591, 489]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 502, 153, 520]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[420, 530, 580, 600]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 630, 235, 648]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 653, 590, 686]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C}\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[408, 705, 590, 725]]<|/det|>
\[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\]  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[440, 732, 556, 762]]<|/det|>
\[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 96, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 806, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the curve which has a gradient of 4 at the point \((0, - 3)\) and is such that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 92, 228, 128]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}y}{\mathrm{dx}^{2}} = 5 + \mathrm{e}^{2x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 103, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 96, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 75, 144, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 74, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
On the axes below, sketch the graph of \(y = |6 - 3x|\), showing the coordinates of the points where the graph meets the coordinate axes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 87, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[131, 123, 863, 472]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 521, 143, 540]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 521, 311, 540]]<|/det|>
Solve \(\left|6 - 3x\right| = 2.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 521, 920, 540]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 753, 141, 771]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 753, 539, 772]]<|/det|>
Hence find the values of \(x\) for which \(\left|6 - 3x\right| > 2.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 754, 920, 772]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 73, 324, 94]]<|/det|>
\[y = x^{3}\ln (2x + 1)\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 143, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 101, 680, 128]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\) when \(x = 0.3\). You must show all your working.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 104, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 602, 141, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 600, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
Hence find the approximate increase in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 0.3 to \(0.3 + h\), where \(h\) is small. [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 109]]<|/det|>
The \(7^{\text{th}}\) term in the expansion of \((a + bx)^{12}\) in ascending powers of \(x\) is \(924x^6\). It is given that \(a\) and \(b\) are positive constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 120, 144, 139]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 292, 139]]<|/det|>
Show that \(b = \frac{1}{a}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 445, 698, 467]]<|/det|>
The \(6^{\text{th}}\) term in the expansion of \((a + bx)^{12}\) in ascending powers of \(x\) is \(198x^5\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 477, 143, 496]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 476, 371, 496]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 477, 920, 496]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 82, 99, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 73, 856, 109]]<|/det|>
The vector \(\mathbf{v}\) has a magnitude of 39 units and is in the same direction as \(\binom{- 12}{5}\). Write \(\mathbf{v}\) in the

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 445, 138]]<|/det|>
form \(\binom{a}{b}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 375, 146, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 888, 425]]<|/det|>
Vectors \(\mathbf{p}\) and \(\mathbf{q}\) are such that \(\mathbf{p} = \binom{r + s}{r + 6}\) and \(\mathbf{q} = \binom{5r + 1}{2s - 1}\), where \(r\) and \(s\) are constants. Given that \(2\mathbf{p} + 3\mathbf{q} = \binom{0}{0}\), find the value of \(r\) and of \(s\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 408, 920, 427]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 82, 94, 102]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 73, 311, 109]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} a & 3 \\ 4 & a + 4 \end{pmatrix}\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 114, 143, 131]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 114, 625, 133]]<|/det|>
Find the values of the constant \(a\) for which \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\) does not exist.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 114, 920, 133]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[111, 377, 143, 395]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 377, 368, 395]]<|/det|>
Given that \(a = 4\), find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 377, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[106, 580, 141, 598]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 572, 529, 603]]<|/det|>
Hence find the matrix \(\mathbf{B}\) such that \(\mathbf{A}\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 4 & -5 \end{pmatrix}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 579, 920, 598]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 94]]<|/det|>
The polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = a x^{3} + b x^{2} + c x - 9\) is divisible by \(x + 3\). It is given that \(\mathrm{p}'(0) = 36\) and \(\mathrm{p}''(0) = 86\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 143, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 106, 526, 125]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 920, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 592, 777, 611]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 592, 920, 611]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

The diagram shows part of the curve \(y = a + 4\cos bx\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are positive constants. The curve meets the \(x\)-axis again at the point \(P\) and has a minimum at the point \(M\).

the exact coordinates of \(P\),

the exact coordinates of \(M\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 253, 920, 289]]<|/det|>
The diagram shows the sector \(OPQ\) of a circle, centre \(O\), radius \(r\mathrm{cm}\), where angle \(POQ = \theta\) radians. The perimeter of the sector is \(10\mathrm{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 301, 143, 320]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 297, 630, 320]]<|/det|>

Question 12 is printed on the next page.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 104, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>12</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|>
The line \(y = 2x + 5\) intersects the curve \(y + xy = 5\) at the points \(A\) and \(B\). Find the coordinates of the point where the perpendicular bisector of the line \(AB\) intersects the line \(y = x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 87, 920, 104]]<|/det|>
